basics.name: Tim Jefferies
basics.label: DevOps and Solutions Architect
basics.summary: An accomplished and adaptable DevOps and Solutions Architect, possessing extensive expertise in system architecture and cloud technology. A track record of successfully building, delivering, and maintaining business and technology solutions in diverse sectors, including internet hosting, finance, charitable organizations, retail, and RPA. Boasting a comprehensive technical background and exceptional problem-solving skills, consistently bridging the gap between organizational requirements and cutting-edge technologies. Applies advanced strategies that align with enterprise and technical standards to drive ongoing improvements. Possessing strong communication skills, able to translate complex technical concepts into easily digestible formats for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Creates collaborative environments and effectively manages expectations to deliver superior results.

work.summary: DevOps Engineer for QA team, supporting Blue Prism RPA Automation SaaS with Azure CI/CD pipelines. Skills used: Terraform, Ansible, Packer, Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Git, Powershell, Python, and Bash.
highlights: Re-designing Azure pipelines that build custom pre-baked Windows images for the QA testing. The original developer couldnâ€™t resolve the constant pipeline breakages and reliability issues. I rebuilt the pipeline to install updates correctly using Ansible and have failovers for times of heavy Azure usage.

Building an automated testing environment using a Jinja2 template that dynamically creates Ansible playbooks to the specification of the user. The QA team's tests had a bottleneck when it came to installing Microsoft SQL and setting up Windows testing environments, so I drastically reduced these tests by building automated images based on Testrail configurations. This saved countless hours of testing time.

Migration from colocated servers into Azure pipelines. Their old QA testing infrastructure was built using an uncommented, unmanaged Python/VirtualBox setup interfaced with Jenkins. I worked as part of the team to redesign the QA testing infrastructure within Azure, using Testrail, Terraform, and Ansible via CI/CD pipelines. The result was a modern, resilient, and efficient QA process.

work.summary: Slater & Gordon were consolidating after acquiring 19 companies. I led infrastructure consolidation and migration of bare metal servers to the cloud.
highlights: Mapped current infrastructure using Visio and proposed new CI/CD models to migrate bare metal infrastructure into the cloud. Performed cost analysis and researched technologies to improve existing processes.
Built initial pipelines and environment, creating an Ansible/Terraform template library scalable to their entire infrastructure.
Wrote new policy documents on Git workflows, DevOps workflows, and documented new processes.

Built a CRM by two-way syncing Wordpress and Airtable.
